metadata.title: CVE-2020-12351 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Improper input validation in BlueZ may allow an unauthenticated user topotentially enable escalation of privilege via adjacent access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-52-generic - 5.4.0-52.57
linux-image-5.4.0-52-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-52.57
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-52-generic - 5.4.0-52.57
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-52-lowlatency - 5.4.0-52.57
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1032-oem - 5.6.0-1032.33
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1022-raspi - 5.4.0-1022.25
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-33-generic - 5.15.0-33.34~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-52.57').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1032.33').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1022.25').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
linux-hwe-5.8 package in focal is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.8.0-25.26~20.04.1').
linux-hwe-5.15 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-33.34~20.04.1').
